faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The course covers the following topics:
1.Discovering customer problems
2.Defining a "value proposition" for a product/service
3.Validating a value proposition
4.Translating product vision into an initial prototype
description.et:
Aines kaetakse järgmiseid teemasid: 
1.klientide probleemide avastamine
2.toote või teenuse väärtuspakkumise defineerimine
3.väärtuspakkumise valideerimine
4.tootevisiooni põhjal algse prototüübi loomine

objectives.en: This course aims at providing students with the opportunity to apply the skills acquired throughout their curriculum in order to conceive and launch a software product or service using the principles of "lean start-ups"
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on pakkuda tudengitele võimalus rakendada õppekava jooksul omandatud oskuseid et mõelda välja ning algatada "kõhna idufirma" printsiipidest lähtuv toodet või teenust pakkuv ettevõte

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, a student will be able to:
learning_outcomes.et: Pärast kursuse edukat läbimist oskab üliõpilane:

learning_outcomes.en: 1.Identify and analyze a problem to be solved by means of a software product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 1.leida ning analüüsida probleemolukordi, mille lahendamiseks saab kasutada kas tarkvara või teenust;

learning_outcomes.en: 2.Explain why current solutions do not address the identified problem(s) or why a new solution is needed
learning_outcomes.et: 2.põhjendada, miks olemasolevad lahendused ei ole antud probleemile sobivad või miks on tarvis uut lahendust;

learning_outcomes.en: 3.Articulate how the identified problem(s) will be solved by an envisioned software product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 3.seletada, kuidas planeeritud tarkvaratoode või -teenus tuvastatud probleemi lahendab;

learning_outcomes.en: 4.Define who are the potential users of a new product or service
learning_outcomes.et: 4.kirjeldada oma toote või teenuse eeldatavat sihtrühma;

learning_outcomes.en: 6.Translate a product vision into an initial prototype

description.et: Define and convincingly present an initial "value proposition" of a Sustainable Digital Solution product or service in front of a jury.
Students have to report their activities by answering a questionnaire that will be sent at the end of the program.
Daily hands-on team-defined tasks. Contribution is monitored by the supervisor and mentors.

grade_preconditions.et:
Students will participate on the following hackathon:

Wednesday, 5.02.2025
10.00 - 10.30 Introduction (structure of the course, theoretical backround etc)
10.30 - 12.00 Team formation and ideation
lunch
13.00 - 14.00 Pitching ideas, team registration
14.00 - 14.45 Teamwork - roles etc.
15.00 - 15.45 MVP canvas
16.00 - 18.00 Value proposition and customer research

Thursday, 6.02.2025
10.00 - 12.00 Value proposition canvas
lunch
13.00 - 15.00 Key partners, activities, resources
15.00 - 16.45 Marketing, customer relationships, channels
17.00 - 18.00 Team feedback time

Friday, 7.02.2025
10.00 - 12.00 Finances and investments
lunch
13.00 - 14.00 Business model 
14.00 - 15.45 Pitching - theory and practice
16.00 -18.00 Pitching and mentoring

Final written version is presented by 14th February 2025.


Suggested form: teamwork

Submit a report describing the product vision to the satisfaction of the course lecturer(s). The report is to be submitted at most one week after the demo presentation.

grade_evaluation.et:
To pass this course, a student has to:
*Define and convincingly present an initial "value proposition" of a Sustainable Digital Solution product or service in front of a panel of entrepreneurs
*Develop and convincingly present a business model or prototype of the envisioned product/service in front of a panel of entrepreneurs and the lecturer(s)
*Submit a questionnaire to be sent at the end of the program.
